name: Query
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query
description:
Query

Represents the search criteria against a Datastore.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("done", "=", false).
  where("priority", ">=", 4).
  order("priority", :desc)

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Run the query within a namespace with the namespace option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = datastore.query("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)
tasks = datastore.run query, namespace: "example-ns"

require "google/cloud/datastore"

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new

methods.name: kind
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#kind
methods.description:
Add the kind of entities to query.

Special entity kinds such as __namespace__, __kind__, and __property__ can be used for metadata queries.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind "Task"

tasks = datastore.run query

methods.name: where
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#where
methods.description: Add a property filter to the query.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("done", "=", false)

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Add a composite property filter:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("done", "=", false).
  where("priority", ">=", 4)

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Add an inequality filter on a single property only:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("created", ">=", Time.utc(1990, 1, 1)).
  where("created", "<", Time.utc(2000, 1, 1))

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Add a composite filter on an array property:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("tag", "=", "fun").
  where("tag", "=", "programming")

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Add an inequality filter on an array property :
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("tag", ">", "learn").
  where("tag", "<", "math")

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Add a key filter using the special property __key__:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("__key__", ">", datastore.key("Task", "someTask"))

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: Add a key filter to a kindless query:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

last_seen_key = datastore.key "Task", "a"
query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.where("__key__", ">", last_seen_key)

tasks = datastore.run query

methods.name: ancestor
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#ancestor
methods.description: Add a filter for entities that inherit from a key.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

task_list_key = datastore.key "TaskList", "default"

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  ancestor(task_list_key)

tasks = datastore.run query

methods.name: order
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#order
methods.description: Sort the results by a property name. By default, an ascending sort order will be used. To sort in descending order, provide a second argument of a string or symbol that starts with “d”.

examples.caption: With ascending sort order:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  order("created")

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: With descending sort order:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  order("created", :desc)

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: With multiple sort orders:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  order("priority", :desc).
  order("created")

tasks = datastore.run query

examples.caption: A property used in inequality filter must be ordered first:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  where("priority", ">", 3).
  order("priority").
  order("created")

tasks = datastore.run query

methods.name: limit
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#limit
methods.description: Set a limit on the number of results to be returned.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  limit(5)

tasks = datastore.run query

methods.name: offset
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#offset
methods.description: Set an offset for the results to be returned.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  limit(5).
  offset(10)

tasks = datastore.run query

methods.name: start
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#start
methods.description: Set the cursor to start the results at.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  limit(page_size).
  start(page_cursor)

tasks = datastore.run query

methods.name: select
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#select
methods.description: Retrieve only select properties from the matched entities.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  select("priority", "percent_complete")

priorities = []
percent_completes = []
datastore.run(query).each do |t|
  priorities << t["priority"]
  percent_completes << t["percent_complete"]
end

examples.caption: A keys-only query using the special property __key__:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  select("__key__")

keys = datastore.run(query).map(&:key)

methods.name: group_by
title: Google
Cloud
Datastore
Query#group_by
methods.description: Group results by a list of properties.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/datastore"

datastore = Google::Cloud::Datastore.new

query = Google::Cloud::Datastore::Query.new
query.kind("Task").
  distinct_on("type", "priority").
  order("type").
  order("priority")

tasks = datastore.run query
